body:
The `--script` has been deprecated in 2.x , that is to say since February stable release. It has been removed since long before. It is still present, but will be removed. We cannot not-deprecate as it is already deprecated in a stable version. 

The post-save-hook is strictly more-powerful that `--script`, and if you have your own package that do whatever you can use `ipython notebook --FileContentsManager.post_save_hook='your.own.module.with.post.save.hook'`

It take less than 5 minutes to create a local package that get the functionality, and shouldn't take more than 5 to make a module that does that on PyPI. 

Then you just ask your users to pip-install it. And you can even programatically set up the post-save in the json config file. 

So we will most likely not un-deprecate. 

If you want to have your own package with a post save-hook, we can help you to set it up though.
